conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles and determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The baffles are the vertical structures labeled A, B, and C.
Baffles are designed to redirect the flow of liquid in a specific direction.
Liquid coming from A is directed by the baffle to the right.
Liquid coming from B is directed by the baffle to the left.
Liquid coming from C is directed by the baffle to the right.
Liquid from A is directed to the right, so it will flow into container D.
Liquid from B is directed to the left, so it will flow into container E.
Liquid from C is directed to the right, so it will flow into container D.
Liquid from A and C will flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Final answer is D and E.
Liquid from A and C will flow into container D, and liquid from B will flow into container E.
Most precise answer based on the flow direction is D for A and C, E for B.
Final answer is D and E.
